meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

main.docTitle: Arbitration (Appointment of Arbitrators and Mediators and Decision on Number of Arbitrators) Rules

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: Appointment Advisory Board (委任諮詢委員會) means the board established under rule 3.

subsection.content: The HKIAC must establish a board known as the Appointment Advisory Board.
The Appointment Advisory Board is to consist of 11 members.

subsection.leadIn: Each of the following persons or organizations is to nominate 1 person to be a member of the Appointment Advisory Board—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chief Justice;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Chairman of the Hong Kong Bar Association;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the President of The Law Society of Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: The Hong Kong General Chamber of Commerce;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: The Chinese General Chamber of Commerce;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the President of The Hong Kong Institution of Engineers;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the President of The Hong Kong Institute of Surveyors;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the President of The Hong Kong Institute of Architects;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the Hong Kong Shipowners Association Ltd.;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the Hong Kong Federation of Insurers;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: the President of the Hong Kong Construction Association.

subsection.content: The HKIAC must appoint the persons nominated under rule 3(3) to be members of the Appointment Advisory Board, for a term not exceeding 3 years.
The HKIAC may re-appoint a person to be a member of the Appointment Advisory Board but not until 2 years have expired since that person was last a member of it.

If there is a vacancy for any reason in the office of any member of the Appointment Advisory Board, the person or organization specified in rule 3(3) who nominated that member is to make a further nomination.
The Appointment Advisory Board may continue to function while there is a vacancy as long as there are at least 6 members on it.
No member of the Appointment Advisory Board may be appointed as arbitrator by the HKIAC during his or her term of office.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Appointment Advisory Board to be consulted

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the appointment of an arbitrator under section 24 of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the appointment of a mediator under section 32(1) of the Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a decision under section 23(3) of the Ordinance on the number of arbitrators that is appropriate for any particular dispute,

section.continued: the HKIAC must consult with at least 3 members of the Appointment Advisory Board with whom the HKIAC is able to communicate, and must consider their advice but is not bound by it.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Procedure for requesting for appointment of arbitrator

subsection.content: Any party to an arbitration agreement requesting for the appointment of an arbitrator by the HKIAC under section 24 of the Ordinance (requesting party) must make the request to the HKIAC in the manner described in subrule (2).

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in Form 1 in the Schedule;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the relevant fee charged under rule 13 (if applicable); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: signed by the requesting party, or by a person authorized to sign on behalf of the requesting party, certifying that the details contained in the request are true and accurate.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: serve a copy of the request on the other party or parties to the arbitration agreement in accordance with section 10 of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: lodge with the HKIAC documentary verification of service.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Appointment of suitable person as arbitrator by HKIAC

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subrules (2) and (3) and rule 5, on receipt of a request made under rule 6(1), the HKIAC must appoint a suitable person to be an arbitrator, having regard to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the nature of the dispute;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether the arbitrators who possess the required qualifications would be available to accept the appointment;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the identity and nationality of the parties to the arbitration agreement;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any considerations in respect of the independence and impartiality of the person to be appointed as an arbitrator;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any stipulations in the relevant agreement; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any suggestions made by the parties themselves.

subsection.content: Before making an appointment of an arbitrator, the HKIAC must allow the other party or parties to the arbitration agreement to give the HKIAC any written information that other party or those other parties consider relevant to the request, including reasons why no arbitrator should be appointed.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: reasons why no arbitrator should be appointed are given to the HKIAC by the other party or parties to the arbitration agreement; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the HKIAC is satisfied that no arbitrator should be appointed,

subsection.continued: the HKIAC may decline to appoint an arbitrator.

subsection.content: If no information mentioned in subrule (2) is given to the HKIAC within 14 days after the date on which a copy of the request is served on the other party or parties to the arbitration agreement under rule 6(3), the HKIAC may proceed to make an appointment of an arbitrator. (L.N. 76 of 2019)
When the HKIAC has made any decision under this rule, it must notify both the requesting party and the other party or parties to the arbitration agreement.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Procedure for seeking decision on number of arbitrators

subsection.content: Any party to an arbitration agreement seeking a decision by the HKIAC on the number of arbitrators under section 23(3) of the Ordinance (seeking party) must make an application to the HKIAC in the manner described in subrule (2).

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in Form 2 in the Schedule;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the relevant fee charged under rule 13 (if applicable); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: signed by the seeking party, or by a person authorized to sign on behalf of the seeking party, certifying that the details contained in the application are true and accurate.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: serve a copy of the application on the other party or parties to the arbitration agreement in accordance with section 10 of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: lodge with the HKIAC documentary verification of service.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Decision by HKIAC on number of arbitrators

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subrules (2) and (4) and rule 5, when deciding under section 23(3) of the Ordinance on whether the number of arbitrators in any particular case is to be 1 or 3, the HKIAC must take into account the following factors—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount in dispute;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the complexity of the claim;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the nationality of the parties to the arbitration agreement;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any relevant customs of the trade, business or profession involved in the dispute;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: whether there are any appropriate arbitrators; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the urgency of the case.

subsection.content: Before deciding on whether the number of arbitrators to be appointed is to be 1 or 3, the HKIAC must allow the other party or parties to the arbitration agreement to give the HKIAC brief written reasons in support of the contention of that other party or those other parties as to whether the number of arbitrators in the particular case should be 1 or 3.

If no reasons mentioned in subrule (2) are given to the HKIAC within 14 days after the date on which a copy of the application is served on the other party or parties to the arbitration agreement under rule 8(3), the HKIAC may proceed with the decision.
The HKIAC may request further information from the seeking party or the other party or parties to the arbitration agreement before it makes a decision.
The party from whom further information is requested must supply the information within 14 days after the date on which the request is made.
If a party fails or refuses to supply the information within the time specified in subrule (5), the HKIAC may make a decision on the basis of the information it has. (L.N. 76 of 2019)
When the HKIAC has made any decision under this rule, it must notify both the seeking party and the other party or parties to the arbitration agreement.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Procedure for applying for appointment of mediator

subsection.content: Any party to an arbitration agreement applying for the appointment of a mediator by the HKIAC under section 32(1) of the Ordinance (applying party) must make the application to the HKIAC in the manner described in subrule (2).

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in Form 3 in the Schedule;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the relevant fee charged under rule 13 (if applicable); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: signed by the applying party, or by a person authorized to sign on behalf of the applying party, certifying that the details contained in the application are true and accurate.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: serve a copy of the application on the other party or parties to the arbitration agreement in accordance with section 10 of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: lodge with the HKIAC documentary verification of service.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Appointment of suitable person as mediator by HKIAC

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subrules (2) and (3) and rule 5, on receipt of an application made under rule 10(1), the HKIAC may appoint a suitable person to be a mediator, having regard to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the nature of the dispute;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether the mediators who possess the required qualifications would be available to accept the appointment;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the identity and nationality of the parties to the arbitration agreement;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any considerations in respect of the independence and impartiality of the person to be appointed as a mediator;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any stipulations in the relevant agreement; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any suggestions made by the parties themselves.

subsection.content: Before making an appointment of a mediator, the HKIAC must allow the other party or parties to the arbitration agreement to give the HKIAC any information that other party or those other parties consider relevant to the application, including reasons why no mediator should be appointed.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: reasons why no mediator should be appointed are given to the HKIAC by the other party or parties to the arbitration agreement; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the HKIAC is satisfied that no mediator should be appointed,

subsection.continued: the HKIAC may decline to appoint a mediator.

subsection.content: If no information mentioned in subrule (2) is given to the HKIAC within 14 days after the date on which a copy of the application is served on the other party or parties to the arbitration agreement under rule 10(3), the HKIAC may proceed to make an appointment of a mediator.
When the HKIAC has made any decision under this rule, it must notify both the applying party and the other party or parties to the arbitration agreement.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Additional forms
section.content: The HKIAC may specify additional forms for use for the purposes of these Rules.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subrules (2) and (2A), the HKIAC may charge $8,000 for making— (L.N. 76 of 2019)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the appointment of an arbitrator under section 24 of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the appointment of a mediator under section 32(1) of the Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a decision under section 23(3) of the Ordinance on the number of arbitrators that is appropriate for any particular case.

subsection.leadIn: The HKIAC may from time to time vary the fee referred to in subrule (1), and the fee so varied (determined fee) must be a fee that— (L.N. 179 of 2013)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: exceeds $8,000 but does not exceed $15,000; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is determined by the HKIAC to be a reasonable fee for the recovery of expenditure incurred or likely to be incurred by it in the exercise of the functions referred to in subrule (1) provided that such variation does not undermine the object mentioned in section 3(1) of the Ordinance. (L.N. 179 of 2013)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: The HKIAC may, if it considers reasonable in any particular case, waive any of the fees referred to in subrule (1). (L.N. 76 of 2019)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must display notices setting out the determined fee at an appropriate and prominent location or locations in the premises of the HKIAC as may be determined by it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must publicize the determined fee through the Internet.

subsection.content: The HKIAC may, if the circumstances of any particular case so justify, amend any of the time limits provided in these Rules, whether the time limit has expired.
However, the HKIAC must not amend any time limits agreed by the parties.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Arbitration (Appointment of Arbitrators and Umpires) Rules repealed
section.content: The Arbitration (Appointment of Arbitrators and Umpires) Rules (Cap. 609 sub. leg. B) are repealed.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Transitional
section.content: Despite anything in Part 2, a member of the Appointment Advisory Board established under rule 3 of the Arbitration (Appointment of Arbitrators and Umpires) Rules (Cap. 609 sub. leg. B) repealed by these Rules (previous Board), whose appointment was in force immediately before the repeal, is to be a member of the Appointment Advisory Board established under rule 3 of these Rules on the commencement of that rule until the expiry of the term of that appointment as if the Appointment Advisory Board established under that rule were the previous Board.

schedule.name: sch0
schedule.heading: Forms
schedule.crossHeading: Form 1Hong Kong International Arbitration CentreREQUEST FOR APPOINTMENT OF ARBITRATOR
schedule.text: (This form must be used, in accordance with rule 6 of the Arbitration (Appointment of Arbitrators and Mediators and Decision on Number of Arbitrators) Rules, to request the Hong Kong International Arbitration Centre (HKIAC) for the appointment of an arbitrator under the Arbitration Ordinance (Cap. 609).)

td.p: THE UNDERSIGNED REQUESTS THE HKIAC FOR THE APPOINTMENT OF AN ARBITRATOR UNDER SECTION 24 OF THE ARBITRATION ORDINANCE (Cap. 609):
PARTICULARS OF PARTIES:
(If there are more than 2 parties, set out the details of the other party or parties on separate sheet.)
CLAIMANT:
RESPONDENT:
CONTRACT/AGREEMENT IN RESPECT OF WHICH THE DISPUTE HAS ARISEN: (Enclose a copy or summarize briefly.)
ARBITRATION CLAUSE OR AGREEMENT UNDER WHICH THE APPOINTMENT OF AN ARBITRATOR IS TO BE MADE: (A copy is attached to this request.)
DISPUTE: (Give brief details of the nature of the dispute, the circumstances and place in which the dispute arises, and the amount at issue.)
OTHER RELEVANT DETAILS:

(If applicable, give date on which the other party was requested to agree to the appointment of arbitrator under the contract/ agreement, names of arbitrators proposed, whether the other party has responded or not (if yes, the content of the response and any stipulations in the relevant agreement on the choice of arbitrator) and any other factors to be taken into account by the HKIAC under rule 7 of the Arbitration (Appointment of Arbitrators and Mediators and Decision on Number of Arbitrators) Rules.)

FEE: *A payment of the HKIAC’s fees in the amount of HK$
(if applicable) has been made. A copy of the payment receipt is enclosed. / A payment of the HKIAC’s fees in the amount of HK$ (if applicable) is enclosed.
(The HKIAC to set out the fees payable. The methods of payment are specified at http://www.hkiac.org.)
* Delete as appropriate
CERTIFICATION STATEMENT:
I certify that the details contained in this request are true and accurate.

schedule.crossHeading: Form 2Hong Kong International Arbitration CentreAPPLICATION FOR DECISION ON NUMBER OF ARBITRATORS
schedule.text: (This form must be used, in accordance with rule 8 of the Arbitration (Appointment of Arbitrators and Mediators and Decision on Number of Arbitrators) Rules, to make an application to the Hong Kong International Arbitration Centre (HKIAC) to seek a decision on the number of arbitrators under the Arbitration Ordinance (Cap. 609).)

td.p: THE UNDERSIGNED MAKES AN APPLICATION TO THE HKIAC TO SEEK A DECISION ON WHETHER THERE IS TO BE 1 OR 3 ARBITRATORS UNDER SECTION 23(3) OF THE ARBITRATION ORDINANCE (Cap. 609):
PARTICULARS OF PARTIES:
(If there are more than 2 parties, set out the details of the other party or parties on separate sheet.)
CLAIMANT:
RESPONDENT:
CONTRACT/AGREEMENT IN RESPECT OF WHICH THE DISPUTE HAS ARISEN: (Enclose a copy or summarize briefly.)
ARBITRATION CLAUSE OR AGREEMENT UNDER WHICH A DECISION ON THE NUMBER OF ARBITRATORS IS TO BE MADE: (A copy is attached to this application.)
DISPUTE: (Give brief details of the nature of the dispute, the circumstances and place in which the dispute arises, and the amount at issue.)
OTHER RELEVANT DETAILS:
(Set out any further relevant factors to be taken into account by the HKIAC under rule 9 of the Arbitration (Appointment of Arbitrators and Mediators and Decision on Number of Arbitrators) Rules.)

FEE: *A payment of the HKIAC’s fees in the amount of HK$
(if applicable) has been made. A copy of the payment receipt is enclosed. / A payment of the HKIAC’s fees in the amount of HK$ (if applicable) is enclosed.
(The HKIAC to set out the fees payable. The methods of payment are specified at http://www.hkiac.org.)
* Delete as appropriate
CERTIFICATION STATEMENT:
I certify that the details contained in this application are true and accurate.

schedule.crossHeading: Form 3Hong Kong International Arbitration CentreAPPLICATION FOR APPOINTMENT OF MEDIATOR
schedule.text: (This form must be used, in accordance with rule 10 of the Arbitration (Appointment of Arbitrators and Mediators and Decision on Number of Arbitrators) Rules, to apply to the Hong Kong International Arbitration Centre (HKIAC) for the appointment of a mediator under the Arbitration Ordinance (Cap. 609).)

td.p: THE UNDERSIGNED APPLIES TO THE HKIAC FOR THE APPOINTMENT OF A MEDIATOR UNDER SECTION 32(1) OF THE ARBITRATION ORDINANCE (Cap. 609):
PARTICULARS OF PARTIES:
(If there are more than 2 parties, set out the details of the other party or parties on separate sheet.)
CLAIMANT:
RESPONDENT:
CONTRACT/AGREEMENT IN RESPECT OF WHICH THE DISPUTE HAS ARISEN: (Enclose a copy or summarize briefly.)
ARBITRATION CLAUSE OR AGREEMENT WHICH PROVIDES FOR THE APPOINTMENT OF A MEDIATOR: (A copy is attached to this application with the provisions for appointment of a mediator highlighted.)
DISPUTE: (Give brief details of the nature of the dispute, the circumstances and place in which the dispute arises, and the amount at issue.)
OTHER RELEVANT DETAILS:

(If applicable, give details of the steps taken to request the person provided for in the arbitration agreement to appoint a mediator and the refusal or failure of that person to appoint a mediator, names of mediators and terms of appointment proposed by any party, and any other factors to be taken into account by the HKIAC under rule 11 of the Arbitration (Appointment of Arbitrators and Mediators and Decision on Number of Arbitrators) Rules.)

FEE: *A payment of the HKIAC’s fees in the amount of HK$
(if applicable) has been made. A copy of the payment receipt is enclosed. / A payment of the HKIAC’s fees in the amount of HK$ (if applicable) is enclosed.
(The HKIAC to set out the fees payable. The methods of payment are specified at http://www.hkiac.org.)
* Delete as appropriate
CERTIFICATION STATEMENT:
I certify that the details contained in this application are true and accurate.
